SENT.plain: Anemia is seen in over 80% of patients with cartilage-hair hypoplasia (CHH)
While this is usually mild and self-limited, some patients demonstrate a severe, persistent anemia resembling that seen in Diamond-Blackfan anemia (DBA)
This paper examines the natural history of 12 patients with CHH and severe anemia
Phenotypic features and mutation data (where available) were reviewed, but no significant differences were found that predicted severe anemia
Severe anemia is estimated to occur in approximately 6% of CHH patients and is permanent in more than half of these patients
Thrombocytosis, though not previously reported in CHH, was noted in five patients, similar to that seen in DBA
The role of possible gene-gene and gene-environment interactions is discussed
